movieReview: Good, had one or two eyerolls which is impressive for a horror movie... :)
Great doc for a great band.
Perhaps a little long, but a fascinating story.
movieTitle: Doomed: The Untold Story of Roger Corman's the Fantastic Four

movieReview: He's one of the bests.
I knew several of these songs but this was a good special.
movieTitle: Garfunkel and Oates: Trying to Be Special

movieReview: Meh...  Fine, but unnecessary...

A glance at the last few years of one of the most important artists of my lifetime...  Told through the perspectives of others he worked with during this time as Bowie was living out of the public eye....
movieTitle: David Bowie: The Last Five Years

movieReview: This was very good... And for a space nerd like me to be pretty oblivious of the story, one that needed to be told.
Could have been a bit more focused, but I understand the filmmakers' thinking...
So fucking great..   I saw a clip of this film somewhere and immediately had to watch it.
A beautiful, good film about people suffering and dying for no reason.
Strangely sad.
Good, but definitely stretched out.
I love cults.
Let's take what would have likely been a fascinating documentary and ruin it by rotoscoping it.
A perfectly enjoyable movie.  Not great, but a good rental or cable flick.  I'm not sure why it's got such lousy Metacritic and RT scores.
Not 'hilarious', but funny and cute and stood up better then lots of comedies from the era.
I know I just watched this a few weeks ago, but Coco wanted to so who am I to argue.
A very amateurish documentary about the kids show "You Can't Do That On Television"...  Brought back some good memories but hard to recommend.
movieTitle: You Can't Do That On Film

movieReview: Meh.... it wasn't BAD, but it wasn't good either.  It was pretty generic.  And too long.
Not as good as the original, but what could be.  Still a good, fun film that expanded the universe (though, sometimes too much).
A reasonable dramatization of the Snowden affair.  Restrained for Oliver Stone.

Good, tho I think some of the fawning praise is a bit overdone.  It was a comic book movie, albeit one that had a more original story than most.  It was nice to have an anti-origin story for a change.
Great.  Just enough dark comedy and violence.  Tight and interesting.
He's a funny, vulgar man.
Fantastic opening scene, sags a bit in the middle, but OK.
Still good, same things still bug me.  I found it interesting how confused Corinna was at points regarding timeline and who was 'good' and 'bad'.
This movie was awesome.  Funny and clever and visually exciting.
The best of the HP films so far, but still had lots of problems...  All three of them felt super heavy, with lots of fat to be trimmed.
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

movieReview: Either the best or worst film to see the weekend of my 40th birthday.  WAAAAY better than I expected.  Could have felt maudlin or too 'memberberry', but instead struck a real nice balance.
I was pretty unfamiliar with this case, I kinda wish they had waited to make the doc until the case was ajudicated.  Without that it feels super long for what it is.
I definitely haven't seen these early MST3K episodes.... This was great.
So awesome.
movieTitle: The Robot vs. the Aztec Mummy

movieReview: I was really surprised at how good the new episodes were.  This felt like it fit right in.
This was a horrendous movie, but a great MST3K
This was written and directed by the writer of Reptilicus.   Made me wonder if all of this season of MST3K is gonna be connected
This wasn't actually that bad.... It wasn't that good, but I've definitely seen worse WITHOUT the MST3K treatment.
Rofl this was almost completely devoid of "beasts" or "hollow mountains"...
Marjoe Gortner AND David Hasslehoff?  How could you go wrong?
This was a lot of fun, a nice genre film that also happened to tackle some social issues in an interesting way.
A great little bottle shoot-em-up.  Had a good sense of geometry and the characters were actually developed and distinct.
Meh..  Having lived thru the events this felt a bit too 'adapted'.  It was cool to see the scene shot on our old street, though.

This was not great, but it was OK.  I may be grading it on a curve as my expectation was that Charlie Hunnam was going to be terrible, but he was actually fine.  The plot was slow and the structure left something to be desired.

Such an amazing story... DIdn't feel like your typical 'inspiration porn'.  Yes, Will and his support system are terribly inspiring, but so was the science.  The idea arm transplantation is within human abilities is just amazing.
had its moments but never quite gelled for me. All seemed a little on the nose.
was fascinating. Perhaps a little too abstract at times but still riveting.
a solid doc....  Made me nostalgic for an era, but not for Cassettes themselves...
Really enjoyed this.  I was afraid of "Vine Hit Turned Feature" but my fears were completely unfounded.
A good short, surprised me in a few ways.
I think the filmmaker wanted to surprise me but didn't.  Felt super on the nose.
Ok, did not like the ending.
A fine little short, not sure what I'm supposed to take away from it, however.
Almost felt like a special feature for THE PROMISE. I don't mean that as a criticism, it was quite good.
Super entertaining look at one of the worlds best card mechanics, who just so happens to be blind.
Not good.  Probably could have been a good short, but felt SUPER stretched out.
I can watch more or less any short less than 5 minutes long.  This was a nifty little experiment in choreography and editing.
Set on Election Night 2016, this had a PTSD quality to me... There were really funny moments, it's just hard for me to judge.
Funny, a little long...  Apparently going to be made into a feature.
movieTitle: When Jeff Tried To Save The World

movieReview: Nice performance from Mary Elizabeth Winstead and a happy little short about failure.
This was my favorite short this year....  Fun, weird, musical, and fast.
Slice of life of someone you'd rarely get to meet in life.
Fascinating doc about a uncovered collection of letterpress plates for movie ads, ranging back to the silent era.  Made me want to get some plates.
Maybe i'm just picking nits, but this guy seemed like more of a watch repairman.  Fine, but not that interesting.
Too long, but interesting.  A profile of a town that hosts the home bases of 3 different traveling circues and the people that make it up.
Fantastic. I went in pretty ignorant as to its plot and loved the whimsy and mood.
had me laughing my ass off.  Everyone should see it when it comes out this summer!
Great performances and a tight, nuanced story. I look forward to what comes next from Justin Chon.
A snapshot of the Oakland police department in crisis as it attempts to restore the city's trust.
The third in a series, THE TRIP TO SPAIN may have been the best.  It felt tighter and more consistent.
LANDLINE was funny at times but felt directionless at others. It seemed like it had an identity crisis.
Meh.... It was OK, but felt like a huge step down from the first.   Felt forced at times.

A great portrait of a fascinating artist.  The thing I enjoyed about it the most is that it assumed you know about David's film career and instead focused on what shaped him and his painting/mixed media work.

Maybe it's the added context of ~20 years (and becoming very familar with Lynch's work) but I enjoyed this much more than I remembered when I saw it originally.  Maybe disappointing from a perspective of a fan of the show, but quite good for a fan of Lynch.  That said, it isn't perfect by any measure.
movieTitle: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

movieReview: Interesting, though I'm not exactly sure how it'd hold up had I not just watched FWWM.  Still, lots of interesting content and context.... Some of the scenes of the Palmers helped to establish them as characters.
Meh.  Didn't need to exist, probably a little better than Prometheus (which I liked better than most), but still a bit too paint-by-numbers.
This was a fun episode of MST3K, but an INANE film lol.

Jayne Mansfield and Mickey Hargitay in an Italian production of a story nobody asked for.  MST3K has a higher budget than this film.  It looked so bad and the script was horrid.  PERFECT MST3K fodder though lol.  The last few minutes where everyone was "singing" killed me.
Pretty fun!  DC remembered that people watch superhero movies to see people be super heros.
A solid doc on one of the great albums, "Bridge Over Troubled Water"
Meh.  While a fat cat is detestible, some horseshit faith healer is as well.  Seeing them argue is unfulfilling.
Interesting look at the cognitive dissonance of the author of the Anarchist Cookbook.
Probably a bit better than 7, but nothing special.
Still really good.  I noticed the cinematography more this time, it's a very pretty film.
MST3K was great live, and they really found a beautiful transfer of this hot mess of a film. ;)
Really great.  Solid action, beautiful cinematography and choreography, and likeable (albeit thin) characters.
Still just as wonderful as I remembered.
Interesting, but WAAAAAY too long...
I love this movie (now series) so anything about it is super interesting.  I had kinda forgotten just how many stars got their start in this film.
movieTitle: Hurricane of Fun: The Making of Wet Hot

movieReview: I have such a soft spot in my heart for Old Rhinebeck Aerodrome....  This is a good profile of the place and the people behind it.
Nolan is such a craftsman.  This was a great film.  So glad I was able to see it in 70mm.
Meh....
Bill is hilarious....
movieTitle: Bill Burr: You People Are All The Same

movieReview: Larissa and I stumbled across this on cable... The video was fucked up, so I switched to my copy..  Still pretty great.
Quite good.  I was expecting more John Wick given it's pedigree and trailers, but it ended up being more of a spy movie, which isn't a bad outcome.
Coco wanted to watch this for her birthday.  Who am I to complain?  Still great.
Meh.  Felt like some kind of weapon porno.
Still lots of fun, but definitely feels dated.
Even though I just watched this a few weeks ago this was probably the first time I saw it on a big screen.
Holy crap this was terrible.
Wow, I can't believe this was a movie.  But it was a solid riff!
So great.  I definitely haven't seen this since I was a child and never on the big screen.  There was so much I had completely forgotten about;  I'm not even sure I ever saw it in one sitting.
movieTitle: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

movieReview: Well put together, band sounds great, what more could you ask?
Still so many amazing moments, though this home video release has so many of the non-Queen songs removed.  A shame this wasn't shot on film, it's held back by the video quality.
movieTitle: A Concert for Life: A Tribute to Freddie Mercury

movieReview: I'm not really into The National, but this wasn't really a doc about them.  It's about two brothers trying to figure each other out.  I enjoyed this.
I had kind of forgotten about this whole thing....  It makes sense that Joel would kind of give up on pop music soon after this, it seems like you'd be hard pressed to surpass this experience.
movieTitle: Billy Joel: A Matter of Trust - The Bridge to Russia

movieReview: Revisited both the album Graceland and the controversy around it's inception and release.
Finally caught up with this IFFBoston 2017 doc.  Really good, if not infuriating.

Second time seeing this in a theatre.  The first time was opening weekend and my group of 3 friends were the only people in the theatre.  This time, it was a packed house of ~1000 people.  Weird Al gave a Q&A afterwards which was really fun.
Filling in some of the history of Harvard Square from before I moved here.
movieTitle: Touching History: Harvard Square, the Bank, & the Tasty Diner

movieReview: Meh.  It was ok... The parts of kids being kids was really well done, but the horror parts were kind of boring...  Relied too much on foley and soundscape to generate jump scares, which imho is the cheapest way to scare an audience.
Great documentary on the Voyager missions on their 40th anniversary.

While I'm pretty sure I had seen this before, it was as a kid, on a 19" TV.  I didn't really remember much of it, so I'm not even sure I saw the whole thing.  Seeing it "for real" for the first time on the big screen and a 70mm print?  Magical.
Still a pretty solid, fun movie.
Still pretty fun, dragged a bit more on second viewing.
This was a kung fu movie.  I'm not a big fan of kung fu movies.
movieTitle: The Man with the Iron Fists

movieReview: What an amazing story.
Still OK....  I feel like this movie will be a little worse each time you see it.
Still really funny...
Nice profile of one of our greatest living filmmakers.

A surprising sequel!  I'm not a huge fan of the original;  However seminal, it always felt incomplete.  This movie provides actual story and character arcs, dialog is less 'flat', and felt like a good extension of the great worldbuilding in the first.  Could have lost some running time, likely, but not a ton.
Pretty solid biopic-ish film, a bit too long.
A nice coming-of-age film, great directorial debut for Greta Gerwig.
A nice film, a touch too long, and not particularly 'special'.  Kinda milquetoast I guess?
Harrowing documentary about members of the Hasidic community in Brooklyn leaving.
A fine overview of Bitcoin.
Bad, bad bad.  Threw away all of the interesting parts of King's story and kept the barest framework.  Had little-to-nothing to do with the original story save some character names.
Meh...  Felt more like an "unauthorized biography" than a real documentary...  Had some interviews with band members, but more interviews with other various hangerson.
movieTitle: The Rise and Fall of The Clash

movieReview: Least shitty Marvel movie in awhile.... I wanted it to be funnier, but it's also not bad.
Watched this again before attending the live taping of the "How Did This Get Made" podcast.  Glad I did, it helped me remember all of the terrible facets of this movie...
Was "home" sick, seemed like a good movie for that situation.  I was correct.
Showed this at FUMN.  Was received as expected.
This has been on the FUMN list forever, just got around to showing it ~20y in.  As gross as I would have expected.

Another one that was on the FUMN list forever.  A little slow but better than I would have expected.  If this truly is the last FUMN, it is kind of full circle.  The first FUMN ended with Salo, "documenting" Italian crimes at the end of WW2.  This documented Japanese crimes.
Fell into this on live TV.  Still enjoyable.
Pretty solid Agathie Christie adaptation.  Good cast, good execution.
This was the least awful Zack Snyder DC film.  It was not terrible.
Still so wonderful.  Perhaps the first time I've seen it on the big screen, and the first time I've seen it in ages.
A solid look at an actor in a full "method" immersion, and the pros and cons of it.
Oldman kills it, tho the makeup was a bit much...  Solid look at 30 crucial days in history.  Also an interesting companion piece to DUNKIRK.
A great cap to a wonderful season.  Great to know there is more coming in the future.
A good profile of one of our greatest science ambassadors.
A fun movie, and a refreshing non-reboot.  I still think the first Raimi Spiderman film is superior, but I think this kid is a better Spidey than Tobey Maguire.
I haven't seen this in ages, Coco played it on a whim.  Still hilarious.
A fascinating story of a man with a tenuous grasp on the truth and the reporter who should have had his guard up a bit more.
A thought-provoking doc about a character I haven't thought about in decades.
It was fine.  But not special at all.
Very mediocre, but not terrible.  A fine sick day afternoon cable watch.

It's alright.  I'm typically not a huge GDT fan, I usually find him way too much style w/o enough substance.  But this movie was toned down a bit, still a very specific style, but also some interesting ideas and plot.  Still not my cup of tea.
A little review before THE LAST JEDI premiere on Thursday!
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens

movieReview: One of the best.  A wonderful expansion and remodeling of the Star Wars universe.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VIII - The Last Jedi

movieReview: A good look at the life and illness of Roger Ebert.
Better than I expected, tho I've never seen THE ROOM.
Good, but it felt manipulative (all movies are inherently, but this one FELT it).
Had a few actual real good laughs and was decently amusing the rest of the time.
Still pretty fun.  The FX are simply amazing.  You know they are puppets, but they still look amazingly real.
This is a great movie.
This was fine as a cable/rental watch, but it wasn't much else.  Some decent laughs, but mostly just raunch for the sake of it.
Never gets old.
This movie is great, and it was interesting seeing it with kids.  They were riveted by it.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VIII - The Last Jedi

movieReview: A solid finale to this prequel trilogy...  Better than the second film, imho.
movieTitle: War for the Planet of the Apes
